response.overview: "... is inspired by the only passage in Jean Paul Sartre's writings which has ever specifically concerned me – the passage from Nausea wherein the protagonist sits in a park and imagines his suicide." - S.B.  Black Vision was made by Brakhage from the print he had struck of Sartre’s Nausea, re-editing it and embellishing it with ink and scratching. It is a silent 2.5 minute film and does not feature the voiceover included in Sartre's Nausea.
response.title: Black Vision

titles.title: Sartre's Nausea
titles.type: (actually the original sound commission that Brakhage transfigured into the silent Black Vision)
